meanings.sent1: She quickly seised the opportunity to help her friend.
meanings.sent2: He seised the toy from his little brother's hands.
meanings.sent3: The cat seised the chance to pounce on the unsuspecting mouse.
meanings.sent4: The sun seised the sky with its radiant light.
meanings.sent5: The detective seised the criminal before he could escape.

meanings.definition: The act of taking possession of
meanings.sent1: The seising of the treasure was a thrilling moment for the explorers.
meanings.sent2: After the seising of the land, the farmer started planting crops.
meanings.sent3: The seising of the last cookie caused a playful food fight among the kids.
meanings.sent4: The seising of power by the villain led to chaos in the city.
meanings.sent5: The seising of the crown marked the beginning of the royal ceremony.

meanings.definition: The legal right to possess or own property
meanings.sent1: His seising of the house was confirmed by the official documents.
meanings.sent2: She inherited the seising of the family heirloom from her grandmother.
meanings.sent3: The seising of the title deed brought a sense of security to the new homeowners.
meanings.sent4: The seising of the trademark ensured exclusive rights for the company.
meanings.sent5: The seising of the territory granted them control over valuable resources.
